actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on the Budget, H. Rept. 95-1456.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #713 (217-178).
Referred to Senate Committee on the Budget.
Committee on the Budget discharged in Senate.
Measure passed Senate, amended, in lieu of S. Con. Res. 104, roll call #372 (56-18).
Motion to instruct Senate conferees passed Senate (See S. Res. 562).
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 95-1594.
House receded and concurred in Senate amendment with an amendment, roll call #811 (225-162).
Conference report filed in Senate, S. Rept. 95-1205.
Senate agreed to House amendment, roll call #397 (47-7).

official_title: A resolution revising the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal year 1979.

summary.text: (Conference report filed in Senate, S. Rept. 95-1205) Sets forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 1979. States that the recommended level of Federal revenues is $448,700,000,000, and the appropriate level of total budget outlays is $487,500,000,000. States that the amount by which the aggregate level of Federal revenues should be decreased is $21,900,000,000, and that the appropriate level of total new budget authority is $555,650,000,000. Establishes the appropriate level of the public debt at $836,000,000,000. Sets forth the appropriate level of new budget authority and the estimated budget outlays for each major functional category. Sets forth the Education, Training, Employment and Social Services function at $32,900,000,000 for new budget authority and $30,300,000,000 for outlays. Sets forth the General Purpose Fiscal Assistance function at $8,800,000,000 for new budget authority and $8,800,000,000 for outlays.

titles.title: A resolution revising the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal year 1979.
